parts.text: You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
Tell me about the School of Business at LIU.

The School of Business at LIU has grown significantly and is a leading institution for business programs. It offers up-to-date curricula, preparing graduates who are realistic, practical, eager to learn, and value good citizenship. The school currently has over 10,000 students across eight undergraduate business disciplines and an MBA program with eight emphases. The faculty consists of experienced educators and working professionals.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the history of the School of Business?

As one of LIU’s fundamental pillars, the School of Business (SoBU) has evolved with the university’s growth. Since its establishment, the curricula have been adjusted to meet recent market trends. The SoBU has also improved its physical facilities, increased qualified faculty, and adopted systematic procedures to achieve educational excellence, aligning with the Institution’s mission statement. The School of Business constitutes close to one third of LIU’s student population.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the vision and mission of the School of Business?

The SoBU Vision is to play an effective role in developing a generation of future business leaders capable of significantly influencing policy, practice, and people. The SoBU Mission is to provide Lebanese and International students with an affirmative and career-focused education, upholding analytical and critical thinking, ethical apprehension, and cultural conscientiousness in expected global business leaders. The school is also committed to delivering high-quality teaching, research, and learning opportunities that combine academic excellence with impact upon business and society, through curricula aligned with the latest trends in Business industries.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What are the graduation requirements for Bachelor of Business Administration programs?

In the Bachelor of Business Administration programs, students must successfully complete a minimum of 99 credit hours, which include: 1-A minimum of 24 credit hours of General Education Required courses. 2-A minimum of 42 credit hours of Core Business Required courses (Minimum 40% of total credit hours requirements) with a minimum GPA of 2.0. 3-A minimum of 33 credit hours of Major Required courses (minimum 25% of total credit hours requirements) with a minimum of 2.00 in both the Major GPA and the Cumulative GPA.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What are the graduation requirements for Master's Degree of Business Administration programs?

In the Master's Degree of Business Administration programs, students holding a Bachelor degree in Business Administration related majors must successfully complete 39 credit hours (500 or above Business courses) as indicated below: 1-A minimum of 21 credit hours of Core Required courses. 2-A minimum of 12 credit hours of Major Required courses. 3-A minimum of 6 credit hours of Major Elective courses. For more details, or for any other inquiries, you can email sob@liu.edu.lb.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.

How long is the Business undergraduate program at LIU?
The Business undergraduate program at LIU usually lasts for 3 years.

What documents are required to apply to LIU as an undergraduate student?

To apply to LIU as a bachelor student, you will need to prepare the following documents: Certified copy of the Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree (BACCII) or Technical Baccalaureate degree (BT3) or their equivalence (Foreign Baccalaureate). TOEFL (International IBT) or IELTS score, if available, or you must sit for the LIU English Placement Test. 1 copy of the identification card. 1 copy of family civil status record. 1 recent passport sized colored photograph. All Lebanese applicants must submit their national social security papers (daman), if available, or must pay $135 and fill the appropriate papers at the social security office. $30 non-refundable application fees. $20 for each Entrance exam. If you are in need of financial assistance, you can pick up an "Application Form for Financial Aid" from the Public Relations Office.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What undergraduate majors are available in the School of Business?

The School of Business offers several undergraduate majors, each requiring 99 credits (except LIU-Worms International Business Management which requires 101 credits). These include: Accounting Information Systems, Economics, Banking & Finance, Hospitality Management, Business Management, Management Information Systems, Marketing, and International Business Management. There is also the LIU-Worms International Business Management program.

What are the requirements for applying to a graduate program in the School of Business at LIU?

To apply for a graduate program in the School of Business at LIU, you will need the following documents: Certified copy of the Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree (BACCII) or Technical Baccalaureate degree (BT3) or their equivalence (Foreign Baccalaureate). Certified copy of the university Degree. Certified copy of the university transcript. 1 copy of the identification card. 1 copy of family civil status record. 1 recent passport sized colored photograph. All Lebanese applicants must submit their national social security papers (daman), if available, or must pay $135 and fill the appropriate papers at the social security office. $50 non-refundable application fees. $20 for English Entrance exam. If you are already an LIU student, you will need to pass by the admissions office to fill out an application form and pay the $50 non-refundable application fees. If you are in need of financial assistance, you can pick up an "Application Form for Financial Aid" from the Public Relations Office.

Can I transfer to LIU's School of Business?

Yes, LIU welcomes all students from around the world to transfer and gain an American-style education. LIU has various transfer and study abroad programs, offering exposure to new cultures, lifestyles, and academic experiences. All transfer student transcripts will be reviewed to determine which courses are transferable towards their chosen program of study at LIU. There are a number of majors you can transfer to.

What are the admission requirements for the freshman program?

To complete the freshman program, each student must complete at least 30 credits in Freshman Arts, Freshman Sciences, or Freshman Engineering. Students must also complete the SAT I and SAT II to receive accreditation by the Ministry of Education. The Admissions Office combines SAT I and SAT II quality points for evaluation. The minimum required scores for Freshman Arts are SAT I and SAT II combined score of 2600, and for Freshman Sciences/Engineering are 2750. Additionally, a certified copy of the Freshman permission from the Lebanese Ministry of Higher Education, certified copies of grades 10-11-and 12, copies of identification and family civil status records, a recent passport-sized colored photograph, and a non-refundable application fee of $30 and an English entrance exam fee of $20 are required.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
How can I apply for financial aid at LIU?

Students may apply for financial aid by filling out an application form obtained from the Students’ Affairs Office (SAO). Upon obtaining the application, students should schedule an interview with a Financial Aid Officer (FAO) at the SAO and submit the complete form with appropriate documents before the official deadline. Dates and deadlines are updated on the LIU website and academic year calendar. The application deadline is the end of the 5th week of an academic semester. Financial Aid applications must be renewed every academic year by filling a 'Renewal Form' from the SAO. The Financial Aid Committee reviews each application carefully and makes the appropriate decision.
